title: Rogan grills Zuckerberg on how Facebook moderates controversial content
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg spoke to Joe Rogan about how dealing with controversial content on Facebook has "trade-offs all the way down."

title: TikTok trend explained: Quiet quitting isn't actually about quitting
description: CNN's Allison Morrow explains to "Nightcap's" Jon Sarlin why the term "quiet quitting" is about setting workplace boundaries, not about actually quitting your job. For more, watch the full Nightcap episode here.

title: Satellite images show US launching retaliatory airstrikes in Syria
description: The United States carried out more airstrikes in Syria following a rocket attack that injured US troops, according to a US official. The conflict between the US and Iranian-backed groups in Syria is escalating and unfolding quickly, reports CNN's Oren Liebermann.

title: Marvel star plays off Asian stereotypes while guest hosting late night
description: "Shang-Chi" star Simu Liu both calls out discrimination and leans into Asian stereotypes while making his guest-hosting debut on "Jimmy Kimmel Live."

title: Long-awaited UN report on Xinjiang may be further delayed
description: It's been four years since a committee of United Nations experts called attention to "credible reports" that more than 1 million Uyghur and other Muslim minority peoples were interned in extrajudicial camps in Xinjiang in northwestern China for "re-education" and indoctrination.

title: Russian-held nuclear plant disconnected from grid after nearby fires, Ukraine says
description: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, which is held by Russian forces, was completely disconnected from the power grid for the first time in its history on Thursday, according to the country's nuclear operator.

title: Family begs Biden to help bring LA public defender home
description: Eyvin Hernandez has been detained since March in Venezuela, CNN's Julia Vargas-Jones reports. His family is pleading with the US State Department to take on his case and help bring him home.

title: Biden to hammer Republicans on abortion rights as he shapes midterm message
description: President Joe Biden on Thursday is expected to use the presidential bully pulpit to call out GOP efforts to curtail women's reproductive rights, as well as draw contrasts on other key issues, as he makes a wide-ranging midterm elections argument for Democrats.

title: Myanmar junta charges former UK ambassador
description: The United Kingdom's former ambassador to Myanmar has reportedly been detained by the country's military junta.

title: Watch: UN human rights chief defends stalled report on CNN
description: At the end of her tenure as U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights, Michelle Bachelet talks about challenges the world faces in China, Myanmar and Brazil.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell being sued by attorneys' firm for nearly $900,000 in unpaid legal fees
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein's former confidante now serving a 20-year prison sentence for child sex trafficking, is being sued for more than $878,000 in unpaid legal fees by a law firm representing her, according to court documents.

title: Champions League group stage draw announced
description: Bayern Munich will face Barcelona and Inter Milan in this season's Champions League group stage after the draw took place on Thursday in Istanbul.

title: US Justice Department requests redacting of Mar-a-Lago affidavit
description: The Justice Department has submitted under seal its proposal for redacting the Mar-a-Lago search warrant affidavit, the department said Thursday.

title: Are your plants dying in drought? You might need to pour them a martini
description: Many people in the northern hemisphere have spent the summer reaching for a boozy drink at the end of the day to take the edge off the scorching, dry heat. It turns out that a tipple may be just what plants need too.

title: Record-breaking heat wave in Europe will be the norm by 2035, analysis shows
description: The record-breaking heat wave that swept across Europe this year will become the "average" summer by 2035, even if all countries reduce their greenhouse gas emissions by as much as they have pledged to, according to an analysis published Thursday.

title: Paul Newman's daughters are suing the Newman Foundation
description: Two of Paul Newman's daughters have filed a lawsuit against the Newman's Own Foundation, alleging that the charity has gone against their late father's wishes by not giving enough funds to charitable organizations of their choosing.

title: Indian kickboxer, 24, dies after collapsing in ring
description: Indian kickboxer Yora Tade died at a government hospital in the southern Indian city of Chennai on Tuesday after collapsing in the ring during a national championship final match.

title: Horatio Sanz accuser seeks to add more 'SNL' alums to lawsuit
description: More than a year after a Pennsylvania woman filed a lawsuit against comedian Horatio Sanz, SNL Studios and NBCUniversal, she's filed a proposed amended complaint seeking to add Tracy Morgan, Jimmy Fallon, and "Saturday Night Live" creator Lorne Michaels as defendants, arguing they enabled Sanz's alleged misconduct.

title: Unvaccinated Novak Djokovic withdraws from US Open
description: Twenty-one time grand slam champion Novak Djokovic has announced his absence from the upcoming US Open via a Twitter post on Thursday.

title: US carries out additional airstrikes in Syria following rocket attack that injured US troops, US official says
description: The US carried out additional airstrikes targeting enemy positions and rocket launchers near Deir ez-Zor in northeast Syria following a rocket attack on coalition bases in the region that injured three US troops on Wednesday, according to a US official.

title: Could Europe see a nuclear disaster? Hear what expert says
description: Repeated shelling at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, the largest of its kind in Europe, has raised fears of a potential disaster. Nuclear expert Ross Peel breaks down the threats to the plant.

title: How to calmly handle the most common home disasters
description: As I lounged in my bed the morning of December 30, I was three months into living in my dream (and first) apartment. Basking in the golden light from my window, I felt so thrilled and relaxed having a day off after an incredibly stressful move.

title: 'A little creepy?': CNN anchors weigh in on new 'Pinocchio' trailer
description: CNN's John Berman, Kaitlan Collins and Omar Jimenez discuss the newly released trailer for "Pinocchio" from Disney Plus.

title: Olivia Wilde recalls being served at CinemaCon as 'vicious'
description: Olivia Wilde has shared how she felt about being publicly served legal documents in a new interview.

title: Artemis I will deliver the first biology experiment to deep space
description: When NASA's Artemis I launches next week on a journey to the moon, no animals or people will be onboard, but it will still carry biology investigations to see how living things react to the deep space environment. The Orion spacecraft will carry items like yeast, algae, fungi and seeds rather than a traditional crew.

title: Why Tesla's stock is so so much cheaper today
description: Tesla's stock price is set to drop at the opening bell Thursday, but not because of anything Elon Musk tweeted about demand for electric vehicles, 'full self-driving' features, SpaceX updates, silly memes or his legal battle with Twitter.

title: Doppelgängers lived in the same city and kept being mistaken for one another. Hear their story
description: Doppelgängers -- people who resemble each other, but are not directly related -- still seem to have genetic similarities, according to a new study. CNN's Don Lemon speaks with a pair of doppelgängers who took part in a photo project, as well as the co-author of the study.

title: Nick Cannon set to welcome his ninth child
description: Nick Cannon is going to be a dad again.

title: Spectacular images revealed in weather photography competition
description: Dramatic lightning strikes, extreme climate events, icy spectacles and sublime sun scenes are among the stunning images shortlisted for the Weather Photographer of the Year 2022 competition.

title: Long Covid is keeping as many as 4 million Americans out of work
description: The pandemic continues to cast a shadow over the workforce. Long Covid, a combination of symptoms that emerge months or even years after recovering from the virus, is keeping up to 4 million Americans from working, according to a new study.

title: Oscar Mayer is now selling frozen wiener pops
description: Two summer staples — hot dogs and popsicles — are coming together. For whatever reason.

title: Human remains found in receding Lake Mead identified
description: Human remains found at Lake Mead more than three months ago have been identified as Thomas Erndt, who is believed to have died by drowning two decades ago, authorities in Nevada said Wednesday.

title: Here's why you still look terrible in virtual reality
description: Mark Zuckerberg has bet his company's future on an ambitious long-term vision of people carrying out greater portions of their lives in virtual spaces through digital alter egos. But an image Zuckerberg recently posted to his Facebook page served as a reality check of sorts for virtual reality, at least in its current form.

title: Ukrainian Premier League match halted four times by air raid sirens and takes over four hours to complete
description: A Ukrainian Premier League (UPL) football match in Lviv was halted four times on Wednesday as a result of multiple air raid sirens at Skif Stadium in Lviv, according to the UPL.

title: Everything you wanted to know (and more!) about pickleball
description: Nobody quite knows why pickleball is called pickleball.

title: Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy launch new golf competition held in custom-built arenas
description: Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy will headline a new, Monday night golf competition set to launch in January 2024.

title: Shaquem Griffin, former Seattle Seahawks linebacker and 'true inspiration,' announces retirement from NFL
description: Former Seattle Seahawks linebacker Shaquem Griffin -- who the NFL called "a true inspiration" -- officially announced his retirement from the NFL on Wednesday.

title: New images show prisoner cages being erected in Mariupol
description: New images show metal cages at the Mariupol Philharmonic Hall in Mariupol, Ukraine, that will purportedly be used to hold Ukrainian prisoners of war for expected trials to be held by Russian-backed authorities. The UN said they are concerned that the Russian Federation and affiliated groups could be planning trials for Ukrainian prisoners of war around the country's independence day. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

title: Chinese city 'stretched to the limit' as millions wait in line for Covid tests in extreme heat
description: The Chinese metropolis of Chongqing has rolled out mass Covid testing in its central area amid a record heat wave, leaving millions of residents standing under the sun for hours as they struggle with extreme temperatures and power shortages.

title: Distressed farmer shares video of livestock dying in extreme heat
description: Across China, farmers are struggling to save their livestock and crops, as huge parts of the country bake under a record-breaking heat wave that has lasted more than two months. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout takes a look at the toll on farmers and local residents..

title: Inside Flightradar24, the website that tracks every plane in the sky
description: On an average day, more than 200,000 flights take off and land across the world. That includes commercial, cargo and charter planes -- which account for about half of the total -- as well as business jets, private aircraft, helicopters, air ambulances, government and military aircraft, drones, hot air balloons and gliders.

title: Legendary Vietnam War photographer Tim Page dies at 78
description: Photographer Tim Page, whose images and exploits from the Vietnam War made him a legendary figure of journalism in the 1960s, died Wednesday in Australia at the age of 78, fellow journalist Ben Bohane confirmed to CNN.

title: US Open's 'Tennis Plays for Peace' raises $1.2 million for Ukraine relief
description: On Wednesday, the US Open held its 'Tennis Plays for Peace' event for Ukraine relief ahead of the start of the year's final grand slam event, raising $1.2 million, according to the United States Tennis Association (USTA).

title: Meet 'Snappy Gilmore,' the viral TikTok sensation reinventing the golf swing
description: Trying out golf for the first time, something just didn't feel right about the conventional swing for Eliezer Paul-Gindiri.

title: North Korea reports suspected Covid cases on China border two weeks after declaring victory over virus
description: Two weeks after North Korea declared victory over the coronavirus, the country has reported four suspected cases in a province near its border with China.

title: Thailand has suspended its prime minister. What happens next?
description: Thailand's Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has temporarily stepped aside as the country's leader but remains its defense minister, according to a government spokesman.

title: 'Give me an f-ing break': Commentators debate Biden's student debt forgiveness plan
description: Republican commentator Scott Jennings and Democratic strategist Maria Cardona debate whether President Joe Biden's plan to forgive federal student debt for any borrower making under $125,000 a year is good for the country.
